comments.body: This seems like it should depend on bash
But bash is generally available under mac and linux, why do we need `bash` from conda?
I did not knew Bash was available from conda-forge. I guess if we follow the spirit of conda, this package should avoid dependency on system packages, including this one. Makes sense.
How about removing `noarch` and using https://github.com/conda-forge/git-bash-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml on Windows?
I tried but bash_kernel could not start with git-bash. I did not try to debug though.
Okay, then I think we need to remove bash here or remove noarch and skip windows.  https://github.com/conda-forge/bash-feedstock/blob/6e15f814dd32ec95a449a48a63f2762dd019e06a/recipe/meta.yaml#L22
I think now that we are explicitly requiring bash conda would fail to solve on Windows even if you have bash installed.  I'd say remove bash here.

Are you referring to bash from linux subsystem under windows 10? Since the recipe fails with or without `bash` requirement, I tend to keep it as is until we find a way to make `bash_kernel` works under windows.
Yeah, WSL isn't there in the CI.  Seems odd to me to preclude it from being used there for an ideal of having allthethings on conda-forge.
actually, *from* wsl you'd be identified as linux anyway.  sorry for the noise.

you might as well depend on `m2-bash` on windows.

OK, I spent more time on `bash_kernel` under windows. There appears to be two problems, one with conda, and one with `bash_kernel` itself that prevents the use of `bash_kerne` under windows. I have submitted to bug reports 

https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/9465
https://github.com/takluyver/bash_kernel/issues/96
